'Planctomycetes' are a phylum of aquatic bacteria and are found in samples of
brackish, and marine and fresh water. They reproduce by budding. In structure,
the organisms of this group are ovoid and have a holdfast, called the stalk, at
the nonreproductive end that helps them to attach to each other during budding.

Cavalier-Smith has postulated that the Planctomycetes are within the clade
Planctobacteria in the larger clade Gracilicutes.
